user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1 is: A project shall not contain unreachable code.

</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of OS_CountSemGetInfo:
```c
int32 OS_CountSemGetInfo(osal_id_t sem_id, OS_count_sem_prop_t *count_prop)
{
    OS_common_record_t *record;
    OS_object_token_t   token;
    int32               return_code;

    /* Check parameters */
    OS_CHECK_POINTER(count_prop);

    memset(count_prop, 0, sizeof(OS_count_sem_prop_t));

    /* Check Parameters */
    return_code = OS_ObjectIdGetById(OS_LOCK_MODE_GLOBAL, LOCAL_OBJID_TYPE, sem_id, &token);
    if (return_code == OS_SUCCESS)
    {
        record = OS_OBJECT_TABLE_GET(OS_global_count_sem_table, token);

        strncpy(count_prop->name, record->name_entry, sizeof(count_prop->name) - 1);
        count_prop->creator = record->creator;

        return_code = OS_CountSemGetInfo_Impl(&token, count_prop);

        OS_ObjectIdRelease(&token);
    }

    return return_code;
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are related to the target function OS_CountSemGetInfo:
#define OS_CHECK_POINTER(ptr) BUGCHECK((ptr)!=NULL,OS_INVALID_POINTER)
...
int32 OS_ObjectIdGetById(OS_lock_mode_t lock_mode, osal_objtype_t idtype, osal_id_t id, OS_object_token_t *token)
{
    int32 return_code;

    return_code = OS_ObjectIdTransactionInit(lock_mode, idtype, token);
    if (return_code != OS_SUCCESS)
    {
        return return_code;
    }

    return_code = OS_ObjectIdToArrayIndex(idtype, id, &token->obj_idx);
    if (return_code == OS_SUCCESS)
    {
        token->obj_id = id;

        /*
         * The "ConvertToken" routine will return with the global lock
         * in a state appropriate for returning to the caller, as indicated
         * by the "check_mode" parameter.
         *
         * Note If this operation fails, then it always unlocks the global for
         * all check_mode's other than NONE.
         */
        return_code = OS_ObjectIdConvertToken(token);
    }

    if (return_code != OS_SUCCESS)
    {
        OS_ObjectIdTransactionCancel(token);
    }

    return return_code;
}
...
#define OS_SUCCESS (0)
...
#define OS_OBJECT_TABLE_GET(tbl, tok) (&tbl[OS_ObjectIndexFromToken(&(tok))])
...
extern OS_common_record_t *const OS_global_count_sem_table
...
typedef struct OS_common_record OS_common_record_t
...
typedef struct OS_object_token OS_object_token_t
...
int32 OS_CountSemGetInfo_Impl(const OS_object_token_t *token, OS_count_sem_prop_t *count_prop)
{
    int                                 sval;
    OS_impl_countsem_internal_record_t *impl;

    impl = OS_OBJECT_TABLE_GET(OS_impl_count_sem_table, *token);

    if (sem_getvalue(&impl->id, &sval) < 0)
    {
        return OS_SEM_FAILURE;
    }

    /* put the info into the structure */
    count_prop->value = sval;
    return OS_SUCCESS;
}
...
void OS_ObjectIdRelease(OS_object_token_t *token)
{
    OS_ObjectIdTransactionFinish(token, NULL);
}
</additional code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation:
I have listed all code fragments that could potentially be unreachable depending on macro expansion or the return behaviors of the called routines (BUGCHECK/OS_CHECK_POINTER, OS_ObjectIdGetById, OS_ObjectIdTransactionInit/Cancel/ConvertToken, OS_CountSemGetInfo_Impl, sem_getvalue). These fragments should be investigated because control-flow may be altered by those macros/functions causing some code paths to never execute.

Other parts of the provided code were not included because they are simple single-line declarations or obvious returns that are reachable given the adjacent control flow, or they are helper wrapper functions whose bodies are trivial (e.g. OS_ObjectIdRelease calling OS_ObjectIdTransactionFinish). The fragments omitted do not present additional, independent potential unreachable-code concerns beyond those already reported (no code appears syntactically placed after an unconditional return, no obvious constant-false conditionals, and no dead labels).
